title: AtalaGOTCHI
description: トランザクション・メタデータの境界は無限ではないし、深淵にまで探究されているわけでもない。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers have not made a clear case for what the use of metadata is solving here? It appears they may want to try and gamify stakepool selection with metadata based virtual creatures that evolve, but exactly what they are doing and how users interact with it is not clear.
f6_assessments.q1: No clear plan for what will be built be when and how users and stake pools will interact with it has been presented. Please present a time line with deliverables outlining who the users are and how you will market to them.
f6_assessments.q2: Please provide timelines so that progress can be measured. Please define what success looks like and the metric you would use to measure that. Is the goal here to change stake pool delegation decisions? If so how will you measure if you have been effective?

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is to create a NFT that will morph based on it consuming other tokens as feeds and will bread. This is an interesting NFT/collectable concept and has some similarities with such products in other chains. The concept of feeds being airdropped to delegator of " single StakePool" is interesting. However, since the technology is not touching non-blockchain world its impact and adoption will be limited.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers had not referenced their past work experience or any software in the open domain that that they had contributed. Based on the claim of experience as a senior dev it can be expected that they will be able to make the project in the required timeframe.
f6_assessments.q2: The project is simple and aims to create NFTs with metadata. The amount requested is reasonable for the task involved. If the related contracts and the schema is made open source it will be useful for the community since there are other use cases for similar structure. Like the price of a real-world item. Based on the inputs (feeds) from reliable addresses price of an item can be calculated. Therefore there are possibly other use cases also. Hence it is important the development for this proposal be made in an open source manner which will also help in the audit of the project. The deliverable can be monitored thus the project is auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: Well I see this proposal as a great way to show the power of transactional metadata throu gamification. Seems very promising.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposers have a good professional experience and know exactly what they are talking about, but It would have been better if they included links to their GitHub.
f6_assessments.q2: The general idea and expectations are clear but the proposal lacks a detailed plan and a timeline.

f6_assessments.q0: In light of the sheer amount of proposals by the main proposer in totally different topics and most of the time without any plan or coherence in the proposal I'd advice against funding this proposal. The proposal does not really adress the challenge, as it is very vague and will be hard to be put within the framework of this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: No real plan for implementation is presented here.
f6_assessments.q2: No milestones or proper metrics are presented here. This proposal cannot be audited.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement in the proposal refers to transactional metadata, however reading the solution and detail plan it is not clear when and how metadata would be used in the project. There are mentions of NFTs and Smart Contracts and one can assume that that's where metadata takes places, but it not clear to understand in it fit in this challenge. Note that is for projects or POC where metadata solve the problem traceability, authentication, and auditability for example. I recommend to better develop the idea behind metadata usage.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is composed by several members with tracked experience that give confidence for a successful outcome. Although there's an explanation of what Atalagochi is, there's not a step-by-step plan on how to achieve the goal of the project. That makes difficult to understand completely the feasibility of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does not include a detail plan of actions nor timelines. It neither presents deliverables or something that can be use to track the progress of the project. And because the budget is not broken down, it will be hard to generate transparency to the community.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposer has flooded catalyst with subpar proposals, and many of which are very similar if not identical. Contradicting claims have been maid throughout their proposals, and none of them provide any real plans or any real supporting material. This proposal makes no sense in the metadata challenge and does not solve any real world issues.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposer has flooded catalyst with subpar proposals, and many of which are very similar if not identical. Contradicting claims have been maid throughout their proposals, and none of them provide any real plans or any real supporting material.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposer has flooded catalyst with subpar proposals, and many of which are very similar if not identical. Contradicting claims have been maid throughout their proposals, and none of them provide any real plans or any real supporting material.

solution: アタラゴッチの計画は、ダイナミックでインタラクティブなコレクターズスペースを作ることです。
experience: シニアエンジニア、AWS、エンタープライズテック/システム、リスクナラティブ
